emuInput.TitMainTitle: Police officer Oliver Mason, badge no. 287, surrounded by children of Rideout family, including two girls holding looms, on front steps, Beltzhoover, another version
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 1, 1955, pg. 25, reads: "Children's Friend - Patrolman Oliver W. Mason has long been a friend of children in neighborhood wherever he lives and those he becomes acquainted with on his various police 'beats.' His hobby is showing movies and picture slides to the youngsters in the community.  He owns his equipment and pays all of the expenses involved himself.  He is shown, several years ago, with four of the Rideout children, in Beltzhoover, where all lived at that time."
